com.radiusnetworks.proximity.licensing

Class LicenseManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.radiusnetworks.proximity.licensing.LicenseManager

  • public class LicenseManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Class used to check to see if the license is valid for the ProximityLibrary. The basic idea is that a call will be made to the server with the user's token and if it gets a valid response, access is granted. However, if the server cannot be reached for some reason, or if the server returns an ambiguous or erroroneous resopnse, the user will be given continued access. Access is only denied if the server gives a deliberate response to the check saying the license is invalid, or if a configured license cannot be found at all.

    Currently, the implementation looks for a ProximityKit.properties file on the classpath, and tries to pull out the PKAPIToken field as the license key. The server URL that is checked is the PKKitURL with the hostname replaced with licensing.radiusnetworks.com

    This implementation leaves plenty of room for the user to defeat the licensing mechanism, including: 1. disabling internet access for the app

    Both of the above will eliminate the ability to access ProximityKit data.
